# Arpeggio: Minor 7b5 in C# (Shape: D)

An arpeggio is created by playing the individual notes of a chord separately rather than simultaneously. The Minor 7b5 arpeggio, also known as half-diminished 7, consists of the root note, minor third, diminished fifth, and minor seventh.

## Notes and Intervals:
- **Root (C#)**
- **Minor Third (E)**
- **Diminished Fifth (G)**
- **Minor Seventh (B)**

The intervals in this arpeggio are a minor third (3 semitones), diminished fifth (6 semitones), and minor seventh (10 semitones) above the root note.

## Genre and Musical Flavor:
The Minor 7b5 arpeggio is commonly used in jazz, fusion, and other styles that incorporate complex harmonies. It has a mysterious and tense quality due to the dissonant intervals present in the arpeggio. This arpeggio can add a sense of sophistication and complexity to compositions when used effectively.
